overview: Free help and advice on becoming self-employed, £2,000 pounds help from the New Enterprise (NEA) and information on Enterprise Clubs
title: Becoming self-employed

table.title: Information and support for new businesses

table.body:
##New Enterprise Allowance (NEA)##

If you are getting Jobseeker’s Allowance, you could get access to business mentoring and a financial package worth up to £2,000. This includes a weekly allowance and access to a small loan.

The [NEA](http://www.direct.gov.uk/en/Employment/Jobseekers/programmesandservices/DG_198864 "new enterprise allowance"){:rel="external"} may be available if both the following apply:

- you are claiming Jobseeker's Allowance
- you have been unemployed for 26 weeks or more

##Enterprise Clubs##

Help may also be available through [Enterprise Clubs](http://www.direct.gov.uk/en/Employment/Jobseekers/programmesandservices/DG_198877 "Enterprise Clubs"){:rel="external"}. Enterprise Clubs will provide unemployed people interested in self-employment with a place to:

- meet and exchange skills
- make contacts
- share experiences
- receive support
- encourage each other to work through their business ideas

^[Contact Jobcentre Plus](http://los.direct.gov.uk/default.aspx "contact Jobcentre Plus"){:rel="external"} for more information about the New Enterprise Allowance or Enterprise Clubs.^

*[NEA]: New Enterprise Allowance
